FuncDef:
The radius-server accounting-copy realtime disable command enables a device to stop sending real-time accounting packets to RADIUS accounting copy servers.
The undo radius-server accounting-copy realtime disable command restores the default configuration.
By default, a device sends real-time accounting packets to RADIUS accounting copy servers.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a RADIUS accounting copy server cannot process a large number of real-time accounting packets due to limited performance, run the radius-server accounting-copy realtime disable command to disable a device from sending real-time accounting packets to the accounting copy server to reduce the load of the server.
Prerequisites
Accounting packet copy has been enabled using the accounting-copy radius-server command.
Configuration Impact
After the radius-server accounting-copy realtime disable command is run, the device will not send real-time accounting packets for users and services to copy servers even if the copy servers have been configured in the domain.
Precautions
The radius-server accounting-copy realtime disable command takes effect immediately for online users.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
